intro: Haplochorema extensum, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a small, evergreen herbaceous plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, linear leaves and small, clustered spore-producing structures called strobila. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has a unique life cycle involving a dominant gametophyte stage and a short-lived sporophyte stage. Its simple morphology and ancient lineage make it an important subject in the study of early plant evolution.
